org.sbml.jsbml.validator.offline

Class ValidationContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sbml.jsbml.validator.offline.ValidationContext
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LoggingValidationContext

    public class ValidationContext
extends java.lang.Object
    A ValidationContext object is used to perform offline validation.

    To prepare the context for the validation use the loadConstraints(Class) method, which will loads all the required constraints to validate a object from this class. By default the context will try to validate recursive by searching for the TreeNode interface. This behavior can be changed with setValidateRecursively(boolean).

    To start the validation process call validate(Object) with a object which is a instance of the class for which the constraints were loaded. If not constraints were loaded or the object doesn't match the class, no validation process is started.

    To track the validation process in real-time you can add a ValidationListener to this context by using the addValidationListener(ValidationListener) method.

    The level and version parameter determine which SBML specifications are used. For more informations look up sbml.org

    Since:
    1.2
    Author:
    Roman

    • Method Detail

      • addValidationListener

        public void addValidationListener(ValidationListener listener)
        Adds a ValidationListener to this context.

        A ValidationContext can have multiple listeners and every attached listener will receive the events from the validation.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the loaded constraints

      • didValidate

        public final void didValidate(AnyConstraint<?> constraint,
                              java.lang.Object o,
                              boolean success)
        Calls the ValidationListener.didValidate(ValidationContext, AnyConstraint, Object, boolean) method on all the listeners.

        Will be called every time after a constraints finished the checks.

        Parameters:
        constraint - the constraint that has been validated
        o - the object on which the constraint that has been validated
        success - true if the constraint was successful, false if an error was detected.

      • enableCheckCategory

        public void enableCheckCategory(SBMLValidator.CHECK_CATEGORY category,
                                boolean enable)
        Enables or disables the selected category.

        The enabled categories determines which constraints will be loaded in #loadConstraints(Class, int, int, CHECK_CATEGORY[]). This function won't change the root constraint.

        Parameters:
        category - the category to enable or disable
        enable - a boolean to tell if we enable (true) or disable (false) the category
        See Also:
        #loadConstraints(Class, int, int, CHECK_CATEGORY[])

      • enableCheckCategories

        public void enableCheckCategories(SBMLValidator.CHECK_CATEGORY[] categories,
                                  boolean enable)
        Calls #enableCheckCategory(CHECK_CATEGORY, boolean) for every SBMLValidator.CHECK_CATEGORY in the array.
        Parameters:
        categories - the categories to enable or disable
        enable - a boolean to tell if we enable (true) or disable (false) the categories
        See Also:
        SBMLValidator.CHECK_CATEGORY

      • loadConstraints

        public void loadConstraints(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Loads the constraints to validate a Object from the class.

        Uses the CheckCategories, level and version of this context. Resets the root constraint.

        Parameters:
        clazz - the class to load constraint for

      • loadConstraints

        public void loadConstraints(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                            int level,
                            int version)
        Loads the constraints and sets the level and version.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class to load constraint for
        level - the SBML level
        version - the SBML version
        See Also:
        loadConstraints(Class)

      • loadConstraints

        public void loadConstraints(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                            int level,
                            int version,
                            SBMLValidator.CHECK_CATEGORY[] categories)
        Loads the constraints to validate a Object from the given class.

        Sets, as well, the level and version and the enabled categories of the ValidationContext.

        Parameters:
        clazz - the class to load constraint for
        level - the SBML level
        version - the SBML version
        categories - the categories to enable
        See Also:
        loadConstraints(Class)

        Parameters:
        clazz - the class to load constraint for
        attributeName - the attribute name to load constraint for

      • getHashMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getHashMap()
        Gets the validation objects HashMap.

        Constraints can use this HashMap to store additional information if needed.

        Notice that this method doesn't return a copy, but a reference to the actual instance.

        Returns:
        the validation objects HashMap.

      • getLevel

        public int getLevel()
        Returns the used level of SBML
        Returns:
        a positive int
        See Also:
        getVersion(), getLevelAndVersion()

      • getLevelAndVersion

        public ValuePair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> getLevelAndVersion()
        Returns the SBML level and version of the ValidationContext.

        This value determines which constraints will be loaded and in which way broken constraints will be logged.

        Returns:
        the level and version this validation context used.
        See Also:
        getLevel(), getVersion()

      • getRootConstraint

        public AnyConstraint<java.lang.Object> getRootConstraint()
        Returns the root constraint from this context.

        The value may be null if no constraint was loaded. The AnyConstraint.check(ValidationContext, Object) method will be called on the root constraint in validate(Object).

        Returns:
        the root constraint or null if no constraints were loaded
        See Also:
        #loadConstraints(Class, int, int, CHECK_CATEGORY[])

      • getVersion

        public int getVersion()
        Returns the used version of SBML
        Returns:
        a positive int
        See Also:
        getLevel(), getLevelAndVersion()

      • getValidateRecursively

        public boolean getValidateRecursively()
        Returns true if the validation also validate every child of a TreeNode.
        Returns:
        true if the validation is done recursively.

      • isLevelAndVersionLessThan

        public boolean isLevelAndVersionLessThan(int level,
                                         int version)
        Checks if the level and version of this context is less then the given level and version.

        A level and version pair is less if either the level is smaller or the level is equal but the version is smaller.

        Parameters:
        level - the SBML level
        version - the SBML version
        Returns:
        true if the level and version of this context is less then the given level and version.

        A level and version pair is greater if either the level is greater or the level is equal but the version is greater.

        Parameters:
        level - the SBML level
        version - the SBML version
        Returns:
        true if the level and version of this context is greater than the given level and version.

      • getPackageVersion

        public java.lang.Integer getPackageVersion(java.lang.String packageShortName)
        Gets the package version to validate.

        It can return Null or '-1', in which case it means that we do not need to validate the package.

        Parameters:
        packageShortName -
        Returns:
        the package version to validate.

      • setRootConstraint

        public void setRootConstraint(AnyConstraint<java.lang.Object> rootConstraint,
                              java.lang.Class<?> constraintType)
        Sets the root constraints and the root constraint class type.
        Parameters:
        rootConstraint - the root constraint
        constraintType - the constraint type

      • setValidateRecursively

        public void setValidateRecursively(boolean recursive)
        Sets the recursivity of the validation.

        If set to true, the validation context will try to validate also the child of a TreeNode instance.

        Parameters:
        recursive - boolean to indicate if the validation should be recursive or not

      • setVersion

        public void setVersion(int version)
        Sets the version of the context and clears the root constraint.
        Parameters:
        version - the SBML version

      • validate

        public boolean validate(java.lang.Object o)
        Validates the object against the loaded constraints.
        Parameters:
        o - object to be validated
        Returns:
        true if no constraint was broken

      • validate

        public boolean validate(java.lang.Object o,
                        boolean clearMap)
        Validates the object with the loaded constraints and clears the HashMap afterwards if the clearMap is set to true.
        Parameters:
        o - the object to validate
        clearMap - boolean to indicate if we need to clear the context after validation
        Returns:
        true if the object passed successfully validation.

      • willValidate

        public void willValidate(AnyConstraint<?> constraint,
                         java.lang.Object o)
        Allows a ValidationListener to perform some operation before a constraint is called.

        This method will be called every time before a constraints starts its tests.

        Parameters:
        constraint - the constraint that will be called
        o - the object on which the constraint will be called
